movesets.name: Choice Scarf

items.name: Choice Scarf
items.description: Hold item which raises Speed by 50%, but locks holder into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

High Jump Kick is Mienshao's main STAB attack, being able to OHKO many frail threats such as Infernape and Mega Absol while also being able to take out neutral targets such as Flygon when used with Reckless. U-turn provides Mienshao with momentum when none of its other moves can OHKO a potential switch-in and can get chip damage on slower Choice Scarf users such as Jirachi in order to KO them later in the game with High Jump Kick. Knock Off hits Ghost- and Psychic-types and removes items from physical walls such as Gligar and Florges, which are normally safe switch-ins to Mienshao. The last move can be catered to whatever your team needs; Stone Edge to hit Flying-types, Poison Jab to hit Fairy-types, or Aerial Ace to score the OHKO on Chesnaught.

Set Details

Maximum Attack and Speed investment takes advantage of Mienshao's fantastic offensive stats and let it OHKO or 2HKO most of the frail offensive Pokemon in the tier. Choice Scarf further bolsters Mienshao's base 105 Speed and lets it outpace basically every other Choice Scarf user, in the tier as well as setup sweepers such as Haxorus, which it can OHKO with Reckless High Jump Kick. Reckless further increases the damage output of High Jump Kick, allowing it to OHKO Flygon, Haxorus, and Mega Aerodactyl after Stealth Rock damage. Regenerator can be used instead to offset any damage Mienshao takes from entry hazards, especially versus Spike stacking teams, and increases Mienshao's longevity.

Usage Tips

The Scarf set is very effective at keeping momentum by forcing switches and using U-turn, as well as picking off frail opponents throughout the game. Thanks to the power of a STAB Reckless High Jump Kick coming off a 125 base Attack, Scarf Mienshao can also be an effective late game cleaner.

Team Options

Mienshao works very well when coupled with entry hazard support, particularly Spikes, which can be provided by Pokemon such as Froslass, Forretress, and Roserade. Mienshao also appreciates Pokemon that can deal with physical walls such as Hippowdon, Suicune, and Florges so again, Roserade gets a special mention. Pokemon such as Mega Ampharos and basically any Pokemon that can complete a VoltTurn / U-turn core. Pursuit trappers and Pokemon such as Mega Houndoom, Krookodile, and Mega Absol that can remove Ghost-types for Mienshao to spam High Jump Kick are also appreciated. Mienshao also appreciates the removal of Poison-types such as Nidoqueen which can easily take any of its attacks and retaliate with STAB Sludge Wave or Earth Power. Dugtrio can fill the role here very well, as U-turn allows Dugtrio to come in for free and proceed to OHKO Nidoqueen and Qwilfish with STAB Earthquake.

movesets.name: Life Orb

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

A High Jump Kick that is boosted by a Life Orb is a very powerful STAB move, which is able to OHKO or 2HKO most Pokemon that do not resist it. U-turn is used to give Mienshao an easy escape route against Pokemon it would otherwise struggle against such as Florges. Knock Off removes the items of these troublesome Pokemon in order to make them easier to deal with later in the game. The move in the fourth slot fills the role of whatever the team requires. Poison Jab scores the 2HKO on Florges and Aromatisse but misses out on defensive Granbull, Fake Out can be used for priority but is rather weak against more defensive teams, and Stone Edge hits Flying-types for super effective damage but has a pretty significant chance to miss. Drain Punch is another option to heal back health—useful if you choose to run Reckless—but it isn't as good and Regenerator already accomplishes that.

Set Details

Maximum Attack and Speed investment takes full advantage of Mienshao's strong points, and when coupled with Life Orb, turns Mienshao into quite a formidable wallbreaker. Life Orb also gives Mienshao the freedom to switch moves at the cost of 10% recoil each time it attacks. Regenerator is the preferred ability in order to offset Life Orb recoil every time it switches out;it also helps against more defensive teams that try to stall out Mienshao's HP using Life Orb recoil. Reckless, however, can be used in order to allow Mienshao to fire off extremely powerful attacks, but it significantly reduces Mienshao's survivability.

Usage Tips

This set should be used to force switches throughout the game and keep momentum up. U-turn and Knock Off should be the main two moves used early game, while High Jump Kick should be used mid to late-game once Ghost-types have been removed or physical walls have been weakened.

Team Options

Pokemon that can remove Poison-, Ghost-, and Psychic-types in order to allow Mienshao to spam High Jump Kick are much appreciated. This includes powerful wallbreakers like Choice Band Victini and mixed Life Orb Hydreigon. Partners such as Raikou, Mega-Ampharos, Rotom-Heat and Forretress that can provide momentum for Mienshao are also nice to have. Entry hazard support is also nice to turn many 3HKOs into 2HKOs, as well as to allow Mienshao to wear down walls with U-turn more easily.

moves.name: Acrobatics
moves.description: Doubles in power if user has no held item.

moves.name: Aerial Ace
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Ally Switch
moves.description: Switches position with another Pokemon on user's side of the field.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Aura Sphere
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Baton Pass
moves.description: User switches, but passes on all stat changes and some special conditions.

moves.name: Bounce
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn. 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brick Break
moves.description: Destroys Light Screen and Reflect, then hits.

moves.name: Bulk Up
moves.description: Boosts Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Calm Mind
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Detect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Slap
moves.description: Hits 2-5 times in 1 turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Drain Punch
moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.name: Dual Chop
moves.description: Hits 2 times in one turn.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fake Out
moves.description: The user always moves first, and flinches the foe. Can only be used on the first turn out.

moves.name: Feint
moves.description: Only works if the foe uses Detect or Protect; nullifies effects of those moves.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Focus Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Force Palm
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Helping Hand
moves.description: Increases power of ally's moves by 50%.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: High Jump Kick
moves.description: If it misses, user loses HP equal to 1/2 the damage that would have been dealt.

moves.name: Hyper Beam
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Jump Kick
moves.description: If it misses, user loses HP equal to 1/2 the damage that would have been dealt.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.description: Power is boosted 1.5x if user is holding a removable item. Removes the target's item.

moves.name: Low Kick
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Low Sweep
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Me First
moves.description: Uses the foe's attack at 1.5x power. Must be faster to work.

moves.name: Meditate
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Poison Jab
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Pound
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Power-Up Punch
moves.description: Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Quick Guard
moves.description: Protects user and allies from priority attacks.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.description: Lowers damage from physical attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Retaliate
moves.description: Power doubles if the user's teammate fainted the previous turn.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Reversal
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Role Play
moves.description: Copies the foe's ability and overwrites the user's ability.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Smelling Salts
moves.description: Has 120 power on a paralyzed target, but cures it of paralysis.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Swords Dance
moves.description: Boosts Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.description: Attacks, then switches.

moves.name: Vital Throw
moves.description: Moves second, but ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Wide Guard
moves.description: Protects user and allies from multi-target attacks.

moves.name: Work Up
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

abilities.name: Reckless
abilities.description: Increases the power of recoil moves by 20%.

abilities.name: Regenerator
abilities.description: Wielder heals 1/3 of its maximum HP on switching out.
